result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew A Pittsley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew A Pittsley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew A Pittsley was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Ms. Rogers, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  No relationships unless previously approved by agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Celebre.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 6 years WSP:  4 years initial confinement w/credit for 105 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP/SAP.  No contact with Ms. Rogers, not to engage in any relationships unless previously approved by agent.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty David Celebre.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1129 - Matter is now resolved. DE enters plea of guilty to Ct2 - found guilty by the court. Cts 1, 3 dismissed outright.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty David Celebre.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved.   JS on 8/29/16 at 8:30 is removed from the calendar.  Defendant's request for a prompt disposition is withdrawn.  Hearing on other acts motion scheduled for 9/22/16 at 11:00.  JS 10/10/16 at 8:30.  JT 10/11/16 at 9:00.  Defense motion to modify bond is argued and denied by the Court.  Bond continued.
to modify bond; filed by Atty D Celebre.
